/.title: Laura's Digital Garden
/.content: Welcome to Laura's digital garden. A personal wiki containing current projects and ideas, with room to grow in any direction.

/notes/Quick-Tips/Creating-a-Python-venv.title: Python Virtual Environment
/notes/Quick-Tips/Creating-a-Python-venv.content:
#python #venv #powershell
Use powershell

cd to the directory to make the venv in
OR
create new directory for it
```python -m venv env```

env/Scripts/Activate.ps1

![[Powershell VENV.png]]

/notes/RTLSDR/ADS-B-Resources.title: ADS-B Resources
/notes/RTLSDR/ADS-B-Resources.content:
Some nice resources I've found in my searches.

## dump1090
#dump1090 #rtlsdr #adsb #python 
	https://github.com/antirez/dump1090
	<iframe src="https://github.com/antirez/dump1090">
	</iframe>
	
![[Running dump1090.bat.png]]

Uses rtlsdr.dll, decodes messages into View1090.exe

When I installed and tested this, I had to reroute to port 8081 in dump1090.bat. I am not sure why, yet.


## pyModeS
Use this for decoding #adsb messages in #python 
	https://github.com/junzis/pyModeS
	`pip install pyModeS`

/notes/RTLSDR/LabVIEW-RTL-SDR-Resources.title: LabVIEW RTL-SDR Resources
/notes/RTLSDR/LabVIEW-RTL-SDR-Resources.content:
#rtlsdr #LabVIEW #adsb 
Look up Albert Lederer's  RTL-SDR Examples on NI.com
Illuminated-G RTL-SDR Repository

/notes/RTLSDR/Setting-up-a-new-RTL-SDR-D.title: Setting up RTL-SDR
/notes/RTLSDR/Setting-up-a-new-RTL-SDR-D.content:
#rtlsdr #adsb #sdr
[RTL-SDR Setup](https://www.rtl-sdr.com/rtl-sdr-quick-start-guide/ "RTL-SDR")

1. Download sdr#
2. install-rtlsdr.bat from sdrsharp zip
3. plug in RTL-SDR dongle
4. run zadig.exe
5. select Interface0 ( may need to go to Options-> List All Devices)
6. run SDRSharp.exe and test it out

/notes/about-me.title: About Me
/notes/about-me.content:
Hello! I'm Laura. 

![Me](avatar.png "Me")
This is my personal wiki, in the style of a dynamic digital garden ðŸª´ using Quartz ~~Jekyll~~ and Obsidian. I'm an two time electrical engineer (BSEE and MSEE) and a LabVIEW developer. I'm forever tinkering with microcontrollers, wearables, home automation, photography, gardening, and anything related to aviation.

/notes/why-garden.title: About Digital Gardens
/notes/why-garden.content:
I love gardening, and I love electrons. Here you will find a combination of both.

This is my space to put ideas out "into the void" while also allowing those ideas to grow.  I have the freedom and ability in this format to prune and nurture these public thoughts over time as I learn and explore.  

I was inspired by [Digital Gardens](https://www.technologyreview.com/2020/09/03/1007716/digital-gardens-let-you-cultivate-your-own-little-bit-of-the-internet/ "Digital Gardens") and my wiki is built upon the excellent [Jekyll Garden](https://jekyll-garden.github.io/).
